              double stPtY,
              double endPtX,
              double endPtY)
       throws edu.ohiou.labimp.gtk2d.InvalidLineException
Creates a Line2d with specified double values

Parameters:
stPtX - x-coordinate of startPoint
stPtY - y-coordinate of startPoint
endPtX - x-coordinate of endPoint
endPtY - y-coordinate of endPoint
Throws:
edu.ohiou.labimp.gtk2d.InvalidLineException - if the startPoint is same as endPoint

offset

public edu.ohiou.labimp.gtk3d.Curve2d offset(double offsetDistance,
                                             int offsetSide)
Returns Line2d which is offset at a distance of 'offset' either on left side or right side of this. Left side / Right side being defined while moving in the direction from start point to end point. Use class variables LEFT_SIDE or RIGHT_SIDE defined in Curve2d to define offsetSide

Specified by:
offset in class edu.ohiou.labimp.gtk3d.Curve2d
Parameters:
offsetDistance - distance to which this needs to be offsetted
offsetSide - side on which this needs to be offsetted
Returns:
an offset of this

Intersects Line2d (this) with Curve2d. This is when curve is Line2d and not Line2d segment. When curve is Arc2d, it does not matter.

intersects

public boolean intersects(edu.ohiou.labimp.gtk3d.Curve2d otherCurve)
Returns boolean indicating whether Line2d (this) intersects with Curve2d. This is when curve is Line2d and not Line2d segment. When curve is Arc2d, it does not matter.

Parameters:
otherCurve - a Curve2d
Returns:
true if Line2d intersects with Curve2d false otherwise

public Point2d pointOnLine(double factor)
Finds a point on Line2d (this) given a factor.

Parameters:
factor - - a double value of the paramater in parametric equation x = xo + p v
Returns:
- Point2d that corresponds to the factor

factorForPoint

public double factorForPoint(Point2d inPoint)
added by chandu 8/17/2006 to retrieve factor for any point on line2d using parametric form x = x0 + pv

isPointInBetween

public boolean isPointInBetween(Point2d pt)
Returns a boolean indicating whether pt is inbetween the end points of this or not. pt need not be lying on this. Note - Algorithm adopted from Joseph O'Rourke's "Computational geometry in C"

Parameters:
pt - Point2d for which the inbetweeness needs to be checked
Returns:
true if pt lies in between the end points of this false otherwise.

epsilonEquals

public boolean epsilonEquals(Line2d otherLine,
                             double epsilon)
Returns a boolean indicating whether this is equal to another Line2d based on the supplied epsilon.

Parameters:
otherLine - Line2d for which the equality needs to be checked
epsilon - double value based on which the comparison is done
Returns:
true if this is equal to otherLine false otherwise.
